abstract.text: Inserts an attachment into the current context.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A URL for the media file to be inserted. This URL must refer to a file saved on the device.

An alternate name for the file. Use an alternate filename to better describe the attachment or to make the name more readable. If you pass a string, the Messages app uses the string as the attachment’s filename. If you pass
, it parses the filename from the URL.
A block that is called as soon as the insertion is complete. This block is passed the following parameter:
An error object. If an error occurred, this object contains information about the error; otherwise, it is set to
error
You can call this method from synchronous code using a completion handler, as shown on this page, or you can call it as an asynchronous method that has the following declaration:

code: func insertAttachment(_ URL: URL, withAlternateFilename filename: String?) async throws

inlineContent.text: For information about concurrency and asynchronous code in Swift, see
Use this method to insert a media attachment into the current context. For the
context, this method inserts the attachment into the Message app’s input field. Users can then send the media file by tapping Send.
For the
context, the method only supports images. It places the image in the Messages camera or FaceTime. If the attachment is not an image type supported by
, the method fails with an
error.

This method operates asynchronously. Although the method returns immediately, the actual work is deferred and performed in the background. As soon as the attachment is inserted, the system calls the completion block on a background queue.
This method does not send the media file. It inserts the media file into the Messages app’s input field. The file is not sent until the user taps Send.

abstract.text: Learn how functions and methods that take a completion handler are converted to Swift asynchronous functions.
Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.
An object that represents a conversation in the Messages app.
Inserts a message object into the Messages app’s input field.
Inserts a sticker into the current context.
Inserts an attachment into the current context.
Inserts text into the Messages app’s input field.
The API is unavailable in the current context.
A constant that indicates the iMessage app appears inside the Stickers app throughout iOS including in Messages, FaceTime, the emoji keyboard, and Markup.
A constant that indicates the iMessage app appears in Messages in the list of iMessage apps that appears when you press the plus button.
A sticker that can be sent as a new message or attached to an existing balloon in the Messages app’s  transcript.
Enable your Sticker pack or iMessage app in the media context.

doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/M.title: Adding Sticker packs and iMessage apps to the system Stickers app, Messages camera, and FaceTime

abstract.text: A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
